byline.contributor: An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Mosul, Iraq.

abstract: Islamic State militants publicly stone to death man and woman in Mosul, Iraq, on charges of adultery; residents say more than dozen stonings and series of public executions have occurred since militants took city.
lead_paragraph: The man and woman were killed in Mosul, and residents said it was one of more than a dozen stonings since the militants took control.

headline.main: ISIS Militants Stone an Iraqi Couple Accused of Adultery
headline.print_headline: Islamic State Militants Publicly Stone an Iraqi Couple Accused of Adultery

snippet: The man and woman were killed in Mosul, and residents said it was one of more than a dozen stonings since the militants took control.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
